content.text:
# Edward Geoghegan

Edward Geoghegan (1813 â€“ 11 January 1869) was an Irish-Australian writer and town clerk. He was born in Dublin, Ireland, and was a medical student when transported  as a convict to Australia in 1840. He wrote a number of plays, including The Hibernian Father the first Australian written play professionally performed in Sydney.
Geoghegan died in 1869.
Plays
*The Hibernian Father (1844)
*The Currency Lass (1844)
*True Love, or an Interlude Interrupted (1845)
*Ravenswood (1843)
*The Last Days of Pompeii (1844)
*The Royal Masquer (1845)
*Captain Kyd (1845)
*Lafitte the Pirate (1845)
